title: Authors and Citation
text: Schulz-Kümpel H (2024). CompInt: Compute comparable interpretable reporting quantities different model objects. R package version 0.1.0,  https://github.com/11annah/CompInt, https://11annah.github.io/CompInt/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {CompInt: Compute comparable and interpretable reporting quantities for different model objects},   author = {Hannah Schulz-Kümpel},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0,  https://github.com/11annah/CompInt},   url = {https://11annah.github.io/CompInt/}, }

what: Compute comparable and interpretable reporting quantities for different model objects
title: Compute comparable and interpretable reporting quantities for different model objects
text: goal CompInt (eventually) allow users compute quantities “formal framework generalized reporting methods parametric settings” variety model objects. Currently, package still mid-development.

title: Compute comparable and interpretable reporting quantities for different model objects
text: can install development version CompInt GitHub :

title: Compute comparable and interpretable reporting quantities for different model objects
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(CompInt)  data(Affairs, package = "AER") poisson.model <- glm(affairs ~ ., family = "poisson", data = Affairs)  draws_gME_religiousness <- get_gME(poisson.model, integration = assumption3(all_empirical()), reg_of_interest = "religiousness", seed = 100) mean(draws_gME_religiousness)  draws_IE_children <- get_IE(poisson.model, integration = assumption3(all_empirical()), reg_of_interest = "children", seed = 100) rowMeans(draws_IE_children)

title: Functions for Assumptions — assumption1
text: functions assumption1, assumption2, assumption3 implement different assumptions model, namely ., .II', .II'', respectively.

title: Draws samples from the parameter distribution of a CompInt_model object. — draws_from_paramdist
code: if (FALSE) { # Example usage glm <- ### some GLM needs to be fit!!! #TOFIX!!!   model <- glm_to_compint(glm) draws <- draws_from_paramdist(model, ndraws = 1000, seed = 123) }  # TOFIX: is importFrom needed here? I mean it depends on the pseudo_posterior fun

title: Calculate Generalized Marginal Effects (gME) — get_gME
text: function computes generalized Marginal Effects (gME) given model regressor interest.

title: Calculate Generalized Marginal Effects (gME) — get_gME
code: get_gME(   model_fit,   reg_of_interest = NULL,   integration = NULL,   seed = NULL,   ndraws = 1000,   separate_interactions = FALSE,   catRIbin = FALSE,   ... )

title: Calculate Generalized Marginal Effects (gME) — get_gME
text: model_fit fitted model object. reg_of_interest regressor interest gME values calculated. integration integration function. Default NULL. #TOFIX ... assumption1 assumption2 assumption3 seed Seed random number generation. Default NULL. ndraws Number draws sampling. Default 1000. separate_interactions Boolean indicating whether interactions separated. Default FALSE. catRIbin Boolean indicating categorical RI binning. Default FALSE. ... Additional arguments passed functions.

title: Calculate Generalized Marginal Effects (gME) — get_gME
text: matrix containing gME values regressor interest.

title: Calculate Generalized Marginal Effects (gME) — get_gME
text: function computes gME values based specified model regressor interest. supports various types models including GLM GLMM. gME values computed either empirically standard options depending distribution.

title: Calculate Generalized Marginal Effects (gME) — get_gME
text: Kümpel, H. & Hoffmann, S. formal framework generalized reporting methods parametric settings. ArXiv Prepr. ArXiv221102621 (2022).

title: Calculate Generalized Marginal Effects (gME) — get_gME
code: if (FALSE) { model <- lm(mpg ~ cyl + disp + hp + drat, data = mtcars) get_gME(model_fit = model, reg_of_interest = "cyl") }
